org.synyx.messagesource.util

Class LocaleUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.synyx.messagesource.util.LocaleUtils

  • public class LocaleUtils
extends Object
    Helper-Class containing util-methods to ease work with Locales.
    Author:
    Marc Kannegiesser - kannegiesser@synyx.de

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static String fromLocale(Locale locale)
      Returns a String-Representation from a Locale.
      static String getCountry(Locale locale)
      Returns the country of the Locale or an empty String if no country
      static String getLanguage(Locale locale)
      Returns the language of the Locale or an empty String if no language
      static Locale getParent(Locale locale)
      Returns the parent of a Locale or null if the locale has no parent.
      static List<Locale> getPath(Locale locale, Locale defaultLocale)
      Returns the Message-Resolving path of a given Locale and default- Locale: Example: de_DE and en_US as default leads to: de_DE, de, en_US, en, null de_DE and null as default leads to: de_DE, de, null de_DE and de_DE as default leads to: de_DE, de, null
      static String getVariant(Locale locale)
      Returns the variant of the Locale or an empty String if no variant
      static Locale toLocale(String locale)
      Creates a Locale from its String-representation.
      static Locale toLocale(String language, String country, String variant)
      Returns a Locale build from the given Strings with its parts while being aware of null-values.

      • toLocale

        public static Locale toLocale(String language,
              String country,
              String variant)
        Returns a Locale build from the given Strings with its parts while being aware of null-values.
        Parameters:
        language - the language
        country - the country
        variant - the variant
        Returns:
        a Locale

      • getParent

        public static Locale getParent(Locale locale)
        Returns the parent of a Locale or null if the locale has no parent. Examples:
        • de_DE would return de
        • de would return null
        Parameters:
        locale -
        Returns:

      • getPath

        public static List<Locale> getPath(Locale locale,
                   Locale defaultLocale)
        Returns the Message-Resolving path of a given Locale and default- Locale: Example:
        • de_DE and en_US as default leads to: de_DE, de, en_US, en, null
        • de_DE and null as default leads to: de_DE, de, null
        • de_DE and de_DE as default leads to: de_DE, de, null
        Parameters:
        locale - the Locale to get the path for
        defaultLocale - the default-locale to consider within the path
        Returns:
        a List containing the path
